formalpara.title: Figure 13. eff-1 expression is repressed by ceh-16 in the embryonic seam cells
formalpara.para: (A) ceh-16(lg16) mosaic for the rescue marker ceh-16::gfp shows seam cell fusions (arrows) and cell migrations (asterisk). B) Mosaic animal as in (A) crossed into eff-1(hy21); suppression of fusion (arrows). (C) eff-1(hy21) animal transgenic for an eff-1::gfp transcriptional construct that is expressed in cells committed to fuse, (D) as in (C) but in addition this animal is ceh-16(RNAi). Ectopic eff-1::gfp expression (de-repression) in the seam cells (arrows) as a result of ceh-16 inactivation and ectopic migration. (E-G) ceh-16(RNAi) embryo transgenic for eff-1::gfp taken at three time points: de-repression of eff-1 expression in seam cells. Seam cells in which eff-1 (expression of eff-1p::gfp) is de-repressed fuse (arrows). All embryos are transgenic for ajm-1::gfp. All animals are 1.5-fold stage except for (E) = bean stage. Scale bars: 10 μm. Reproduced from Cassata et al. (2005), Copyright (2005), with permission from The Company of Biologists.
